opening: Lord, meet us gently today and always
body:
“And your Father who sees what is hidden will repay you”

That line is quietly radical.

It shifts the entire center of gravity of faith.

Not toward performance.
Not toward visibility.
Not toward being noticed.

But toward hidden fidelity.

God is not impressed by what is staged.
He is attentive to what is sincere.

The Father “who sees what is hidden” sees the prayers no one applauds.
The endurance no one affirms.
The obedience that costs you and benefits no one visibly.
The faith that keeps showing up even when it feels unanswered.

Which means

He repays in ways deeper than applause.
Often quieter than we expect.
Often slower than we want.
But always more substantial than what we would have chosen.

It’s a promise of God’s personal involvement with the unseen parts of your life.

He sees.
He keeps record.
He responds.

Even when no one else knows what you are carrying.

Especially then.
